org.jppf.node.protocol

Interface Task<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of results produced by the task.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Runnable, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTask, CommandLineTask, DemoTask, JPPFAnnotatedTask, JPPFExceptionResult, JPPFTask, ScriptedTask

    public interface Task<T>
extends Runnable, Serializable
    Interface for all tasks submitted to the execution server.

    • Method Summary

        run

    • Method Detail

      • getResult

        T getResult()
        Get the result of the task execution.
        Returns:
        the result as an array of bytes.

      • setResult

        void setResult(T result)
        Set the result of the task execution.
        Parameters:
        result - the result of this task's execution.

      • getException

        Exception getException()
        Deprecated. Task.getThrowable() should be used instead.
        Get the exception that was raised by this task's execution. If the task raised a Throwable, the exception is embedded into a JPPFException.
        Returns:
        a Exception instance, or null if no exception was raised.

      • setException

        void setException(Exception exception)
        Deprecated. Task.setThrowable(java.lang.Throwable) should be used instead.
        Sets the exception that was raised by this task's execution in the run method. The exception is set by the JPPF framework.
        Parameters:
        exception - an Exception instance.

      • getThrowable

        Throwable getThrowable()
        Get the Throwable that was raised by this task's execution.
        Returns:
        a Exception instance, or null if no exception was raised.
        Since:
        4.0

      • setThrowable

        void setThrowable(Throwable throwable)
        Sets the Throwable that was raised by this task's execution in the run method. The Throwable is normally set by the JPPF framework.
        Parameters:
        throwable - a Throwable instance.
        Since:
        4.0

      • getDataProvider

        DataProvider getDataProvider()
        Get the provider of shared data for this task.
        Returns:
        a DataProvider instance.

      • getId

        String getId()
        Get the user-assigned id for this task.
        Returns:
        the id as a string.

      • setId

        void setId(String id)
        Set the user-assigned id for this task.
        Parameters:
        id - the id as a string.

      • onCancel

        void onCancel()
        Callback invoked when this task is cancelled. The default implementation does nothing and should be overriden by subclasses that desire to implement a specific behaviour on cancellation.

      • onTimeout

        void onTimeout()
        Callback invoked when this task times out. The default implementation does nothing and should be overriden by subclasses that desire to implement a specific behaviour on timeout.

      • getTaskObject

        Object getTaskObject()
        Get the JPPFRunnable-annotated object or POJO wrapped by this task.
        Returns:
        an object or class that is JPPF-annotated.

      • getTimeoutSchedule

        JPPFSchedule getTimeoutSchedule()
        Get the task timeout schedule configuration.
        Returns:
        a JPPFSchedule instance.

      • setTimeoutSchedule

        void setTimeoutSchedule(JPPFSchedule timeoutSchedule)
        Get the task timeout schedule configuration.
        Parameters:
        timeoutSchedule - a JPPFSchedule instance.

      • isInNode

        boolean isInNode()
        Determine whether this task is executing within a node, or locally on the client side.
        Returns:
        true if this task is executing in a node, false if it is on the client side.

      • compute

        <V> V compute(JPPFCallable<V> callable)
          throws Exception
        Compute a value on the client-side, as the result of the execution of a JPPFCallable.

        Any Throwable raised in the callable's call() method will be thrown as the result of this method. If the Throwable is an instance of Exception or one of its subclasses, it is thrown as such, otherwise it is wrapped into a JPPFException.

        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of results returned by the callable.
        Parameters:
        callable - the callable to execute on the client side.
        Returns:
        the value computed on the client, or null if the value could not be computed.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the execution of the callable in the client resulted in a Throwable being raised.
        See Also:
        JPPFCallable

      • fireNotification

        void fireNotification(Object userObject,
                    boolean sendViaJmx)
        Causes the task to send a notification to all listeners. This method can be called at any time during the execution of the task, i.e. while in the execution scope of the Runnable.run(), Task.onTimeout() or Task.onCancel() method.

        If the parameter sendViaJmx is true, then a notfication will also be sent by the JPPFNodeTaskMonitorMBean mbean, otherwise only local listeners will be notified.

        Parameters:
        userObject - a user-defined object to send as part of the notification.
        sendViaJmx - if true then also send the notification via the JMX MBean, otherwise only send to local listeners. If the task is executing within a client local executor, this parameter has no effect.
        Since:
        4.0
